Interface IAppStoredProgram

Defines the runtime program container used by the application. Provides storage for commands, variables, conditional linking and expression evaluation.

Namespace: Booze_Project
Assembly: Booze Project.dll
Syntax
public interface IAppStoredProgram
Remarks

Implementations manage a program counter (PC) and expose methods for adding commands and variables, evaluating expressions, and driving program execution. The parser and command implementations interact with an IAppStoredProgram instance to register commands, resolve variables and compute expressions.

Properties

| Edit this page View Source

PC

Program counter index (the next command index to execute).

Declaration
int PC { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
int

Add(AppCommand)

Adds a compiled AppCommand to the program. Implementations typically assign the program's canvas to canvas-aware commands.

Declaration
int Add(AppCommand C)
Parameters
Type Name Description
AppCommand C

Command to add.
Returns
Type Description
int

Index at which the command was added.
Exceptions
Type Condition
StoredProgramException

Thrown when C is null or otherwise invalid.
| Edit this page View Source

AddVariable(AppEvaluation)

Register a variable (AppEvaluation) with the program. If the variable already exists the implementation may ignore the add or raise an error.

Declaration
void AddVariable(AppEvaluation Variable)
Parameters
Type Name Description
AppEvaluation Variable

Variable instance to add.
| Edit this page View Source

Commandsleft()

Returns whether there are remaining commands to execute (PC < command count).

Declaration
bool Commandsleft()
Returns
Type Description
bool

true when commands remain; otherwise false.

Evaluates an expression string after substituting variable names with their current values.

Declaration

Parameters
Type Name Description
string Exp

Expression to evaluate (tokens expected to be space-separated).
Returns
Type Description
string

Result of the evaluation as a string.
Exceptions
Type Condition
StoredProgramException

Thrown when the expression is invalid or evaluation fails.

| Edit this page View Source

ResetProgram()

Reset program state: clear commands, variables, condition stacks, reset canvas and PC.

Declaration
void ResetProgram()
| Edit this page View Source

Run()

Execute the stored program starting at the current PC until completion or an error occurs. Implementations are expected to update PC as commands modify control flow.

Declaration
void Run()
Remarks

Errors encountered during command execution should be surfaced via exceptions (for example BOOSE.StoredProgramException).
